author: judy c.

description:
Absolutely loved this restaurant. Would highly recommend and surprised that there wasn't a line out the door. We were seated immediately. 

Food: Plain tofu soup, Spicy Fried Chicken
- fried chicken was authentic/juicy/flavorful/meat-falling off bone, wonderfully presented, better than San Tung
- tofu soup was delicious, just spicy enough, they gave you an egg to break into the soup

Service: 
- Very friendly and attentive staff
- food came out quickly
- they even provided towelettes to wash your hands after the chicken!

Atmosphere
- Clean, well decorated and well lit
- there are only a few tables so the restaurant wasn't too loud
author: Yaya W.

description:
We returned with friends for a 2nd try and shared dishes family style. This time we sat in the rear dining area.  
The wait staff seem inexperienced and not very customer oriented. We tried:
1. Whole fried chicken. Overpriced but very good. $22 you get brined chicken mostly white meat with a nice crispy crust and the meat was moist. I would love to order this again but not for that price. 
2. Kim chi fried rice again. Hubby couldn't even eat 1/2 of it as he got full. The rice this time was not soggy nor over cooked.  It was better but I still wouldn't order again.
3.  Chicken bibimbap hot stone bowl was so much better than the cold bowl but the beef one had better flavor than the chicken. 
4. Mushroom tofu soup. Such a small bowl for the price. I liked the plain tofu one better. 
5. Beef short rib bibimbap. Very little meat. Six small pieces of rib. Would be better to order the meat separately.  I took home the rice as leftover. It was very good with lots of veggies, rice and chicken.  

We were still eating and the waitress would leave the tray with bill. As noted by another Yelper, this is rather rude since we were still eating.  Hubby says we're not going back anytime soon. I found some dishes tasted too sweet.
author: Ry T.

description: I would give a zero star if I could. This place has horrible service. We were a party with 2 adults and 3 little kids. We went to Korean Kitchen for lunch, but had an ealy dinner reservation later in the day at a different restaurant. We ordered 3 entrees to share family style. The waitress asked us to order 1 more dish because we have 6 people. I told her we only have 5 people and one of them is 3 years old. So she says ok. Then when the bill comes, they automatically added a 20% tip. What are they smoking? This is not a fine dining restaurant.
author: T Y.

description:
Passed by this place a few times, and the line was out the door. So, I decided to see how it was.

Four stars for service. They look after you pretty well for an Asian restaurant. I'm taking off one star because the food just wasn't worth waiting outside in the cold weather. The food is just ok...not the best, not the worst Korean food. Flavors were just kind of bland.
author: Rachelle M.

description: Eunice (the manager/owner) and the Chef were very accommodating, allowed me to come up with my own dish (Sautéed Chicken, instead of Squid) with vegetables cooked and served on Iron Skillet. Great banchans/sides (Kimchi's and such). Phenominal service by Carla and Roy.
author: Rawi M.

description: Not good. I hate to come down too hard on what I assume is a family-owned business but if the purpose of these reviews is to help others to choose where to spend their hard-earned money, then I have to do it. Poor ingredients prepared poorly. Bland, colorless flavors, even for this middle-aged white guy. If you're trying to choose between this restaurant and any other restaurant in the Sunset, choose the other one. On the positive side, the service was very efficient.
author: Craig K.

description:
My party waited 40 minutes for a table even though we were told a 10 minute wait. When available seating opened up at the bar they refused to seat my party of 3. Yet another walk in group comes in and is allowed to take the bar seats, despite my party waiting over 40 minutes. 

Terrible service.
author: Robin D.

description: We ate here again and I had bulgogi bibimbap, it was heaven.  Beautiful, the gorgeous vegetables had the right amount of crunch and their color was enticing, the perfect egg on top, the meat perfectly seasoned... Sigh. I can't wait to go again.
author: Jessica L.

description: Eunice is the BOMB, and dem wings?!? What even are those?!?! Soooo GOOOOOD. Easily one of my top three in San Fran.
author: Kyle V.

description: The food is super yummy and the price is reasonable. Pretty sure will come back again.
author: Shuyi L.

description: Wonderful food! It's a great place to enjoy some Korean comfort food! The service was great! 4 of us had pork kutsu, kimchi fried rice, beef tofu soup, spicy fried chicken and spicy pork. We were so stuffed with leftover! The beef soup was very flavorful and the spicy chicken was cripsy with a good spiciness to it. The chicken came with some fries which were cripsy outside and soft inside. The owners used to own the food truck Bobcha and now we can enjoy their yummy food with comfort seating. Glad we went!
author: Ping T.

description: Food is fine. Good customer service. However, the bill is awful because the restaurant add 20% tip without your willing. When the tip become an automatic thing?? And it is 20% now. Also, it is asking for the gratuity on the bill. This is a double tip system. Watch your what you paid for!!!
author: Ray J.

description:
Have eaten here three times in the last two weeks, and absolutely love the place.  Have had the Ramen with bulgogi and tofu soup and the broth is rich and hearty, not watery, the noodles firm and not mushy, the bulgogi is tender and sweet, and the ramen comes in a variety of spice-heat levels from "non-spicy" to "very spicy hot!"  Ramen with bulgogi is $13.00 so on the high side, but not unusual for good Korean food.

Atmosphere is informal and the interior design is clean an  pretty modern.  The service is really good and friendly.

Took a star away for the music - Music leaves a bit to be desired, too much teeny bopper pop and not enough cool ambiance groove beat or house.  

But the awesome food makes up for a lack of groovy music!
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Tried this new Korean restaurant that recently opened in the sunset and I think it is one of the best Korean restaurants in SF. They serve traditional AND street food Korean dishes, which is rare to find in the city. We ordered the seafood pancake, galbi ribs, and dokbukki. All dishes were fresh, delicious and well seasoned. The pancake dish was extra crispy, which made it so good. The prices were affordable and the place inside is very clean and comfortable. oh yeah the service was very friendly and attentive. 

I wish they will offer delivery service soon.
author: Violet G.

description:
Decided to check out the new spot in the inner Sunset. I have to say the flavors were amazing... everything was so good! We started off with the Mandoo (pot stickers)... they were off the charts good. The sauce was a blend of spicy and sweet... when you mixed them together... WOW! There were little plates like samples of tasty treats to try, kimchi, cucumbers, fish cake, potatoes. .. etc. Yum! also had the Tofu soup with mushrooms... I couldn't believe how creamy the tofu was and the flavors were on point! The rice looked like it was mixed with  blackbeans... really yummy, and paired nicely with all of the dishes. We also had the bulgogi. .. delicious...the portions are great for at least 2 people. My absolute favorite was the short ribs... out of this world! 
All in all this place is awesome... a definite must try!
We will be back for sure!
author: Shannan J.

description: I love korean fried chicken but this place was disappointing. Sauces were fine but they give you terrible chicken parts that are not fresh. You can taste how old it is when you bite into it. Also, their fried chicken prices are just too much! $24 for measly amount of chicken parts? No thank you.
author: Han L.

description:
Over priced and small portion for a whole chicken for $20 but it looks like only half chicken served?  I understand  since they probably have to pay lots money for leasing the space?? 

Not many side dishes and no flavor.  Galbi was way way too sweet and again 6 or 8 pieces for $17?  Really? 

I am a Korean and this restaurant is not good! If you don't know anything about Korean food?  You may think they are okay??? but still over priced?? 

The staff was sweet and attentive.
author: Ichi Y.

description: The food here was pretty damn good. Had the KFC in regular and mild spicy, it wasn't dry No complaints about the Kimchi fried rice. Spicy pork was good. Service was super attentive. And the restaurant just looks good. I need to go back to try more items
author: Joey C.

description: Sorry to say, if for food, I can give 3 to 4 stars. But after experienced the bad service today, I have to rate this place down! This is just a normal Korean restaurant like any other ones I went to! The food was not wow nor it was rated Michelin that so many people waiting! They did not info us about their policy of 2 hours limited dining time for a party until we done paying the bill and asked for table clean up and plates for our friends' birthday cake! They are almost like "kick us out" by just brought out our cake and left there and want us to leave after they took our bill and the 20% tips! So if anyone plan to have Birthday dinner here, please be aware their "expected us to know" policy of 2 hours limitation and they can kick you out once you exceed 2 hours! When we exited the restaurant, we see no one waiting for their table, so all I experienced is we were not welcome to be served here and I don't think they deserved that 20% tips! Plus, if they could serve quick and informed us about this policy when we entered, our party won't exceed this 2 hours limitation!
author: Wendy G.

description:
After reading all the raving reviews, we planned on going to Manna, another Korean restaurant on Irving. However, it seems like they cater to mostly couples or 2 persons. They had 7 tables for 2 persons and only 2 tables for 3-4. We had the 3 of us, and it was painful to see parties of 2 that were lower on the wait list be seated before you, especially when you have a hungry child.
After having see 3 parties of 2 be seated while you are stuck in limbo, we decided to just find another one of the great restaurants on Irving. We didn't stumble on a great one, but instead, an awesome one - The Korean Kitchen!
The Korean Kitchen has a far nicer ambiance than Manna (woohoo!), plus plenty of seating for parties of all sizes. I am no Korean foodie, however the dishes looked just as good or even better than Manna. *Can you tell we were so happy we didn't make it into Manna? Lol!*
We had the Kim Chee fried rice, Galbi (nice cuts, not the fatty ones), half fried chicken (deep fried light and crispy), Jap Chae (YUM!), and our daughter ordered a ramen with bulgogi. Every dish was excellent. Not to mention the little condiment dishes with rice that first comes out - great taste teasers!. Roy, our server was super helpful and helped make our dinner very enjoyable.
Of course for any restaurant on Irving, finding parking is an issue. However, once you do park, you will be happy with the many restaurants to choose from. For Korean food, go to The Korean Kitchen!
author: Mark M.

description: This was our first time dining here. And they had a long line. You can't just seat at the bar. You must wait to be seated. Space is limited to 45 seats. Monica was our server and was very nice . She wondered why we asked for her name. I always like to know my servers name . I'd like to address them by their first name. The bulgogi was delish. The Tofu bibimbop was exotic flavors. And we had the mandarin flavored sake was refreshing. We will definitely be back for more!
author: Claire S.

description: I remember this place as a  sushi restaurant, food was OK. But now, as Korean restaurant, food is excellent. I had the soy garlic fried chicken and the Korean kimchi fried rice, it was delicious. Will definitely be back.
author: Gordon P.

description: My favorite Korean spot in the city! Faves I regularly go back for: seafood pancake, tofu soup, jap chae. Reasonably priced and friendly service. Don't think I've ever had a bad meal here.
author: Alice C.

description:
Great new Korean restaurant in the neighborhood. I didn't dine in, but the server was very friendly and thoughtful when I came in to pick up my order. 

Excellent kimchi pancake. Eggy inside and perfectly crispy outside. A great mix of umami, tang and funk. Also, their kimchi itself stands on its own. Nice mix of banchan, even to-go, and the mandoo potsticker tofu soup was peppery red and spicy, ample tofu, a nice mix of zucchini and onion and really supple potstickers. I'll definitely be back.
author: X-topher B.

description: The service sucks majorly. But the food is spot on so I'm not gonna hate. Only tried the bulgogi bibimbap and japchae. Like I said only draw back was the terrible service. Lucky for them I based my reviews mostly on the food.
author: Jake C.

description: Generic Korean Food.  I ordered the Bimbimbap, and tofu soup.  Its OK flavor.  Its lunch total bill is $27 for the 2 items with tips is $31.  Kind of expensive for simple ingredients of veg and rice and a little seafood with squid and shrimp.  This is a new restaurant before was a Japanese restaurent.  I was surprised that the chair was old.
author: Mar H.

description:
My friends and I were looking for a place to each lunch and after looking around for a bit, decided to try this place out, since it's new and my friends love Korean food.
So we step inside, looks clean and bright (a plus), and doesn't look too crowded (another plus, since we can get our food quicker?).  Anyway, the server/host led 3 ladies who were in front of us to the back, so we put our name on the list and waited.  And waited. And Waited. And waited.
In between all the waiting, the server/host came back, but did not even bother to acknowledge us. I said hello to him, he just ignored me, did his stuff and kept us waiting.  Another server came by, looked at us and walked away.  hmm, not a good start. 
What really got me ticked off was that they were saying something in Korean (I understand Korean, by the way), which I will not repeat here, all the while looking at our direction.
So, I told my friends we should go some place where we can actually get real service and some real food.
Well, if your servers are that crappy, I don't care how good your food is, there are plenty of other  restaurants we can go to. 
Didn't eat here and most like not going to spend money where the staff totally ignore you AT THE DOOR!
author: Min K.

description: Came on a Saturday and was seated in back. It was not too busy as it was early on a Saturday but the service was quite good. We had the Galbi, Bulgolgi and mild spicy fried chicken. Enjoyed it all and for the price was a good value. Chocking out the restaurants in the inner Sunset but this place is worth coming back to.
author: Chris T.

description: Came here for dinner on a sunday after spending the day at the Cali Academy of Science. Food was delicious, service was great, not too busy. The servers were super friendly and attentive, answered a lot of questions and made recommendations on the food and drink. The food was really delicious, we had the tofu bibimbap and the beef bulgogi bibimbap in stone bowls. It was a good amount of food, stone bowl is definitely the way to go! Beef was seasoned perfectly, tofu was a little plain but the rest of the bowl was delicious. Price was good, and actually less than we expected in the city. We were given refills on the banchan without even asking, which was great too. I would definitely come back here and highly recommend.
author: Jane S.

description: The fried chicken was crispy and yummy. I wish they had extra dipping sauce for it like the stuff they drizzled over the fries. The jap chae was a bit on the oily side but the taste was all there. I did see a lot of people ordering the pancake so I will have to come back and try it! Parking is a problem in this area especially on the weekends though.
author: W A.

description:
Staff was slow. We walked in and we had eye contact with 2 staffs so i was sure they saw us. But no one cared to greet us or let us know that they will be right with us. We waited about 15min before a waitress finally came up to us and showed us our table. She walked us towards the back of the restaurant and turns out there were 3 empty tables back there.
Maybe because the ceiling was high and the little girl who sat next to us had a high pitch voice, it was very noisy sitting in the back area. Everybody's voice just echoed back from the ceiling and I can't even hear my sister from the other side of the table. They left the back door opened and little fruit flies wanted some of my kimchee fried rice. So that was a little annoying.
The fried chicken was kind of dry. Disappointed. Kimchee fried rice was just ok. Had better. Bugolgi fries was pretty good tho. But overall, it was just ok. Don't see myself coming back.
author: R C.

description:
New Korean spot in the Richmond district. 

For a new spot this place will eventually blow up. Their bibimbap and japchae are really good. My favorite is the kaibi good balance of meat and fat and cooked perfectly. 

Make sure to wash it all down with a nice bottle of soju.
author: Cm Tú Đ.

description: Probably one of the best Korean restaurants you can find in the city. All the food was absolutely incredible. I HIGHLY recommend the Corn Cheese, Fire Chicken (which is really spicy but delicious), Seafood Tofu Soup, and Kimchi Fried Rice. The presentation and service was great as well. Definitely going to come here with my family again to try their other dishes.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Food: had the fried chicken, and it was great. Sides were delicious too.


Atmosphere: fine, nothing special


Service: pretty good
author: Tom D.

description:
WOULLDD be perfect for happy hour (if they had one)..now that kitchen kura closed down. 

Ordered kimchi pancake, sesame kfc, kimchi fried rice. Liked everything. The chicken was sooo juicey and the fries that came with was really good as well.  Fried rice ran on the spicier side but i didn't mind. Pancake was flavorful and crispy.
author: Yue L.

description: I would give it 5 stars if it weren't for the ridiculous number of flies. I managed to kill 3. The service was wonderful, the food was tasty and fair priced, the server even helped reheat my soup because he thought it went cold. The place is great, they just need like a screen door or something.
author: Michael C.

description: Friendly staff, great prices, and solid food. Very relaxed environment. Food orderer: Japchae had great flavor and included beef, fried chicken was okay, but fried dumplings were great. Will def come back.
author: Walt F.

description: The food is pretty good. My friends and I really enjoyed the fried chicken. Overall, I highly recommend this place.
author: Charlene X.

description: We ordered Bibimbap and the taste are great! Prices are okay. The only thing is that there are not too many choices.
author: Danyang W.

description: Love this place! :) Fresh ingredients, decent taste, and great service.
author: Yejoo K.

description: I've been here twice. First time I thought it was mediocre and thought I'd give it a second chance. Went here for lunch with a friend. We had the chicken and the Kalbi. The chicken was cut in these small strips over some shredded cabbage. It was standard but not enough. The kalbi was dry and over cooked. I could tell it was reheated probably from the night before.  Service slow and unpolished. There were only two tables occupied. The waitress would disappear for a long time before returning Then only did once.  You could do a lot better going somewhere else. This is a convenient location but that's about it.
author: H L.

description: Ordered fried chicken and was bland; the 15.99 bulgogi was in a smaller portion than what's it worth. Overall we didn't get full but at least the rice was pretty good. And then you get to eat on a small platter...
author: Gian Carlo B.

description: Great service. Good location. I recommend getting the hot stone bulgogi bibimbap. The fried chicken looked really good so I'll definitely be ordering that next time!
author: Ron A.

description: This review is mostly for the soft tofu soup/Soon Dofu Jigae. I could eat it daily when the weather is cold. I ordered it once with a chicken appetizer and took most of the chicken home. In a group, the Kimchee fried rice, Pancake, cellophane noodles/Jap Chae and a seafood dish was great.
author: Ken U.

description: Was in the neighborhood once and craved for Korean food . The place looks good on the yelp so we decided to give it a try. It was not s long wait so we put our name down and the waiter took a look and told us just few mins . After waiting for 10 mins , they told us the back is closed and there is no sitting for 4 in the front and basically asked us to leave . They could have merged the table and sit us when there is opening . They rather sit small parties and waited 10 mins to tell us ! It's ridiculous and the man did not even say sorry . He is rude and kinda a jerk! I cannot imagine how good their service can be basing on this unpleasant service. There is plenty other place around .
author: Tracy D.

description:
Our party of 3 were going to dine here on a Thursday night. We arrived at 7 and there was two parties ahead of us and a single diner who came in after us. The waitress seated everyone except for us and for some reason refused to seat us at the bar, which was completely empty except the one lone diner. 

She asked if we were okay with sitting at the bar if the wait was long and we said yes. She looked around and came back and said the wait should be 10 minutes. She looked really lost and didn't know what she was doing. We had already been waiting there awhile but we thought it would be fast or she would just sit us at the empty bar. Waited longer and this old couple walks in. The lady strolls right into the kitchen like she owns the place and points to the seats and says something to the waitress. Then seats herself and her partner at the bar while we've been waiting half an hour for a table. The waitress brings them menus and straight up does not care one bit that these people just walked right in and seated themselves while we waited a really long time. 

We see people leaving and yet STILL no table for us. The waitress then tells us they're cleaning and should have a table soon. Said nothing about the couple that walked straight in and acted like it's nothing. By this point we've waited about 40 minutes for a table and there was only 2 small parties ahead of us, but they've seated the guy behind us AND the couple that strolled in and took the bar seats that the waitress refused to give us. The guy was already eating his meal while we were still waiting. 

Absolutely garbage staff who do not care about you. There's no way we were going to give our money to people who treat us like this. We left angry. Got seated immediately at Marnee Thai across the street.
author: Steph Y.

description: I was expecting to have some crispy fried chicken after seeing a photo  on the menu, so I ordered mild spicy chicken. The chicken came out all covered with a brown sauce that I couldn't taste a bit of chicken. Very disappointed! Why the waitress didn't offer me sauce on the side? Why does this cook think that he/she know how much sauce a customer desire? Inform and listen to your customer would be a good rule of thumb!
author: Yvon Y.

description: Orded fish cake soup, kimchi fried rice and fried chicken. Kimchi fried rice was really good. The other two dishes are a lot sweeter compared to other Korean places.
author: Yanfei Z.

description: Looking for another option besides Manna,  This seems to be OK.  The tofu soup is flavorful without being too spicy.  Manna's tofu soup is too spicy and little meat.  However Manna have better and more banchan.  Over all KK uses more salt and seasoning.  The service is kind of different too.  I notice the waitresses are selected for better looks, more make-up where as Manna have girl next door.  I don't think their looks matter, or make a difference in service.  We need more Korean options in this city.  Hope this restaurant make it because since KK opens, Manna's food tasted better!
author: Lantz G.

description:
I don't condone restaurants that think it's okay to seat their acquaintances immediately upon arrival when there are parties that have been waiting close to an hour. 

We arrived around 6:45PM with two parties ahead of us. Four parties of 2-3 left while we were waiting. They must have been understaffed because it took a while before they started seating the parties ahead of us. One of the waitresses asked if we would like to sit at the bar since the previous party of three had just left, and there were now three seats available, and we said yes. She goes to confirm with her manager if that's okay, and she comes back a minute later to tell us we can't sit there, and the next table will be available in 10 minutes. 

I thought.. Sure, that's fine. Maybe they want to keep those seats for single parties... Except at this point, we are the only ones waiting, and no one had come in after us during the next 10-15 minutes. We could have had our meals in front of us by then. 

An older couple comes in, and the woman seems to be an acquaintance or relative of one of the waitresses there. They chat for a bit in the kitchen and hallway, and the couple is then asked if they would like to take those bar seats that have been empty for the past 15-20 minutes. We left immediately. 

Thanks, Korean Kitchen. I'll stick with Manna. At least they treat their customers with respect.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Great food you think right? All the 4* reviews right? So we decided to give it a try!! We ordered japchae and kalby and were given only had small dessert plates and chopsticks to use. Then we realized we wanted a knife and fork to cut the kalby into bite sized pieces on our little dessert plate - well the waitress was not as friendly when we asked for it.  So we're totally enjoying the meal when I saw a hair (yes black strand) stuck to my meat!! Well I called the waitress yet again and then she examined it. Took the plate and the food away without saying so much as an apology! She snuck to the back room and didn't even come out!! Finally another server gave us our bill for the full price. Can you believe it!! Anyway - try the food if you must but beware of anything extra on your food. Happy Eating!!
author: holly z.

description: One star for the very plain ramen. It tasted like chicken broth and onions with pepper. The boiled egg was super hard and over cooked. I've come here before for their bibimbap and fries (both really great) - and I'd come back again for that!
author: Sheela L.

description: Waited ten minutes to be seated and then ten more minutes to have someone not grab my drink order. Customer service is horrible here
author: Vince D.

description:
Best Korean Restaurant in City!!!
Waiting is long got be patience but it's worthy waiting cuz it tastes soooo good.
I had kalbi, seafood pancake and tonkatsu for dinner.
I will definitely recommend and go back there again.
author: Chong Y.

description: only tried their jap chae. it was pretty pricey considering the portion and other places. there were a lot of ingredients and the bulgogi was delicious, marinated well and sweet. but a lil too oily. their side dishes were bean sprouts, kimchi, and fish cake. kimchi was a lil soggy tho. service was great, they were very nice about banchan refills and checking up on us
author: Amy L.

description: Ordered a beef soft tofu soup for takeout. It tasted funny and it turns out they gave me seafood, which I hate. Told my friend about this and she said the same thing happened to her! Shame.
author: Dawnkee K.

description: Terrible service. We waited about 10 mins to be seated, and ultimately opted for two bar seats so that we wouldn't have to wait longer. Note: these seats were open the whole time, and we still had to ask to sit there. No one came to take our order for another 15 mins. We left without so much as a sip of water.
author: Rebecca E.

description: I do like Korean BBQ and this is solid standard Korean. All the usuals and some dishes I haven't seen before. So why 3 stars? This place seats 45 and the turnover is slow. Not set up well for more than two tops. You wait in a narrow entrance where the backs of the chairs are tucked behind a black box mounted on the walk. Yes, I bashed my head on this. I thought I was a yutz until the next 2 people who came in did the same. So you start your meal with a headache, then you have to listen to loud Korean pop and rap. More headache. I could handle the pop at a lower volume, but please. I would say this would be a good place for a young Korean couple with hard heads. I mentioned the chair issue to the host/waiter, but she looked at me like I had Kim chi on my face. The Kim chi was good.
author: Jonathan S.

description: Went there on 3/28, ordered a stone pot as she recommended, it's good no complaints. Service was fast and quick, no line at 5pm yet. Overall will come back and recommend to my friends
author: Jasper K.

description: Ordered Tofu Soup delivery. Cheap delivery via DoorDash ($1.99). Soup was good and tofu chunks were huge. I wish I made it a little spicier, but the flavor was still good for being mild. Was surprised they wrapped some banchan up in foil and included multigrain rice. The kimchee was a little too salty, but the fishcake and pickled cucumber hit the spot! Will order again.
author: Matthew T.

description: This new Korean joint by the 9th and Irving area opened up not long ago. The restaurant is on the smallish side, not a whole lot of tables. No cooking at your table like some other Korean restaurants. It is a bit more on the pricey side compared to Manna down the street. There is a lunch and dinner menu. The food here is quite good and authentic. I had the beef bulgogi in stone bowl. I liked the mixture and crispiness of the rice.
author: Ali F.

description: The food is excellent highly recommended the only drawback is the place is small and tables are very close to each other you can hear other people's conversation.
author: Dave N.

description: We usually go to Manna on 10th and Irving to be able to get a variety of Korean dishes without it being super expensive. This place is comparable with less of a wait. Came Friday night at 630 and was seated immediately. Ordered kimchi fried rice with egg on top, 1/2 soy garlic chicken that came with some fries and cole slaw, seafood pancake, and bulgogi. Next time will go with the mild spicy chicken for more of a kick. Overall good food, really good portions, friendly attentive staff and decent prices!
author: Katy C.

description: Food was delicious, service was good and accommodating. They took my reservation when I called ahead to tell them we're on our way, they seemed hesitant on taking reservations. So glad we chose to eat there. Seafood pancake was light and just crisp on the edges, with Bonita flakes still fluttering when served on our table. The rest of the food was very good too. Would eat here again even though parking can be tough to find.
author: Annie M.

description:
Really liked their food - I believe that location eventually got occupied by a restaurant who will lasts, there was such high turnover in the recent years...many restaurants in the neighborhood and thus competition...
Shared the sea food pancake, Japchae, fishcake soup and bibimbap - everyhing tasted fresh and good...the starters side dishes were very tasty as well. Better than Manna in my opinion - a bit more expensive that your average Korean in the neighborhood but portions are big and food is interesting. Will go back to explore the menu further...
author: VIORICA C.

description: This place newly opened up, and it is already the best Korean restaurant on Irving. It's clean, service is very friendly, and the food is good/solid. The soups/tangs are a bit on the salty side, but it's still overall a pretty clean flavor. You're not getting the best Korean food in the bay area, but it reigns as the king of Irving - much better than Hahn's Hibachi or Manna. It's also relatively affordable, although I wish it was cheaper. I recommend it
author: Jin N.

description: Ordered food via grub hub. Arrived about 15 Min late. The galbi was burnt and tough. Some pieces were completely black. The soybean soup was watery and the vegetables were undercooked. The only thing that was good was the kimchi pancake. Very disappointed.
author: H O.

description: Happy tummies! We love the food especially the kimchi fried rice. So yummy! The portion size was great definitely shareable. The bibimbap was all yummy good flavors! Grilled mackerel was flavorful and grilled well. We will definitely be adding this to our faves! Parties 6 or more 18% gratuity automatic
author: Mel N Viv G.

description:
Really good! I only came here for lunch so I've only had the dol-sot (stone pot) bibimbap, but it tasted exactly like it should... super hot stone pot got that nice layer of crunchy rice, the veggies were marinated nicely and weren't cold (meaning they didn't come straight from the fridge), the bulgogi was well-cooked, and the fried egg had a perfectly runny yolk! Also, the banchan (side dishes), the quality of which I consider a very good measure of a Korean restaurant, were excellent!

Looking at the rest of the menu, they offer most of the basic traditional Korean dishes, as well as some more new school items, all of which I can't wait to try.

If you're thinking of going to Manna, do yourself a favor and go here instead... it's just a couple blocks away, and it's definitely in the argument for Best Korean in SF (which Manna, unfortunately, is not).

Oh, and the prices are reasonable, the service is good, and the restaurant itself is very clean and comfortable.
author: Michael B.

description: Not bad.  Had the kim chee bulgàgigi fries which were very good, soy garlic  chicken that also came with French fries (?!?) And was mostly white meat, combination tofu spicy stew that was supposed served with purple rice with they almost forgot to give us, and the hot stone bibimbap.  Why does Korean food have to be so pricy?  $50 bill for appetizer and three entries.
author: Kid N.

description: Ordered take out from here twice. The first time they didn't give me side dishes...I was a little disappointed but my entree was soooo good. My second time they gave me 4 different side dishes...perfection!!!!
author: Christy L.

description: Food was ok but the wait staff was not much help.  Here's what happened.  Went on Friday for dinner w/o reservations.  We were among several groups waiting to be seated.  After 15 minute wait, without anyone leaving, they call in a party of 4.  Another 15 minutes goes by, again without anyone exiting, they offered to seat us at the counter which we accepted.  Note, these seats were available the entire time that we were there.  Also the kitchen is the other side of the counter so we all ended up smelling like food afterwards.  Couldn't wait to get home and wash the smell off.
author: R K.

description:
The fried chicken is not crispy enough. 
The stone for the bibimbap is not hot enough, therefore did not create that rice crust. The sauce is not as good as other Korean places. Otherwise the bibimbap is not bad. 
Tofu soup is good but we ask for medium spicy and it was barely mild. 
Prices are pretty decent.
author: Gir G.

description: Great food. Presentation and service is superb. Hope they keep it up. Ambient music was also a nice touch. Prices are good specially for the San Francisco Bay Area.
author: Carlos G.

description: My friends and I were visiting the city and decided to come here. Took the food awhile to come out. While i drank my water while I was waiting, the waitress refilled everyone's water except my table where my friends and I were thirsty. Then when we went up to pay, they had charged my friend $25 more than what she was supposed to pay for. The only thing that was good here was the food.
author: Lyn V.

description:
Had lunch there with my wife yesterday. We got the seafood pancake ($10 @ lunch), which was quite a nice sized pancake with quite a bit of seafood in it. The pancake was very crispy, bonito flakes on top, a wee bit greasy, but super yummy.

We also got the galbi bibimbap in stone pot ($13 or so @ lunch). It had a nice assortment of vegetables (bean sprouts, mushrooms, spinach) along with 3 good sized, well marinated and cooked pieces of beef with a fried egg on top. Overall another good dish.

We liked this place slightly better than Manna, the prices are a but more ($2 / dish or so), but the portions also seem a bit bigger.

We took the fried chicken to go for dinner last nite. It came with cole slaw, fries and daikon. Cant really review / rate it very well, since we had it much later. The saucing was plentiful. the mild spice chicken was quite hot (i think they might have made a mistake and given us a hotter version)

Overall a great addition to the neighbourhood. Was reasonably busy at lunch yesterday.
author: Donald L.

description: I liked this place a lot. Not only the food was great, the employees were also very friendly, smiling to us the whole time while serving us.
author: Jackson C.

description: Everything was pretty tasty! Solid drunk food when you're not in the mood for burritos. Apparently "corn cheese" is a thing, and, I don't know what we expected, but it is literally a can of corn with melted cheddar cheese on a plate. And for some reason it was like, $8. That kind of confused us, but oh my god the veggie soup is so good. Most flavorful vegetarian soup in the area. Thanks for not just serving me water with a stalk of celery in it!
author: Stefanie G.

description: we found this small little resturant on a fun little exploring trip in san francisco and fell in love with it! We came about 10 minutes before they opened for their dinner time and they allowed us to come in early and look at the menu to hide from the cold. super tiny but also well kept, we were expecting the food to be either not good or only average but after a bite of our dishes we were amazed! We got the bulgagi meat and kim chi fried rice with an egg on top, which was life changing honestly! The servers were extremely nice and it was plenty of food for an average bill, which was also a huge plus! We will be back again!!!!
author: Alice W.

description:
Flavorful & tasty dishes. The seafood pancake was thin & crispy; probably the best Korean pancake I've had. Other standouts include the Fried Chicken & the Galbi.

Servers were friendly and helpful.

The staff refused taking reservations by phone because they expected it to be a busy night. But the restaurant was half occupied when we arrived.
author: David W.

description: Lived in Korea. Blown away by this place. Delicious authentic Korean fried chicken, excellent other dishes. Staff goes above and beyond in service. Great ambience. Definitely the best Korean food in the city.
author: Matthew P.

description: Absolutely amazing ..must try ..service was friendly also food is best in Sf. I recommend galbi and spicy ck.
author: Andy H.

description: i came this place twice. compare to any korean restaurant around this area, its interior and foods are fancier and better. i ordered fried chicken with spicy sauce and i think, for korean chicken wing style, this place is the best. i love it!!
author: Chris L.

description: Had a strange meal here tonight with man friend. We arrived at an early hour for dinner, and despite two two-tops being open we were eventually offered a seat at the sushi bar. We said we'd rather wait for a table, which we eventually got (there were still open tables near us and nobody waiting). After ordering (3 dishes) we were again asked if maybe we'd be more comfortable at a different, larger table in the back (because somehow there was no way 3 plates would fit on the table?) We again declined to be hidden away in the back room (and there was more than enough room on the table).
author: Elise R.

description: 4 stars for staff. The service here is good but I dislike how small and cramp it is. The food is good but the portion sizes could be a bit bigger. The bibimbap in dolsot needs to be hotter with more rice so you can get the crispy rice at the bottom. I think this restaurant has potential because they can take advantage of later hours like places in Southern california.
author: Joshua Y.

description: The food was pretty good and were nice portion sizes. I wish there were more variations of the ban chan as there were only 4 dishes (but you can refill them!). The chicken looks pretty good but is a bit pricey, might have to give it a try next time!
author: C. L.

description: Here is the best Korean restaurant in SF. If you are unfamiliar with Korean food, here is the best place to start with. On top of that, the service and food quality is awesome. Surprisingly, the price is really reasonable. Especially, I love Galbi, which is beef short rib. I also recommend getting the bibimbap because the ingredients are so fresh and really tasty. Overall, I think this restaurant is 10/10 for service, atmosphere, taste and quality.
author: Roy P.

description: This place is perfect, just what my hubby and I were looking for. Korean fried chickens over soju!
author: Tiffany S.

description: We loved everything we had at Korean Kitchen! The pancake was crispy and the spicy pork bulgogi was tender and the flavor amazing. And fantastic service.
author: A. D.

description: Bibimbap is a must have. The spicy fried chicken is a close second. The place that was here before used to be my spot before they shut down, but it's been replaced by something just as good. I will mos def be coming back
author: Christopher F.

description: Ordered bulgogi bibimbap to-go. It was quite good, but they didn't put any red chili paste with it!! So I had to use Trader Joe's red hot chili sauce, which definitely wasn't the same... big bummer.
author: Tony G.

description: The food is okay. Its more of a drinking place i think. Fried chicken was not that good. I was visiting from Oregon and we wanted eat some Korean food. Bibimbap was decent. Its a cute area there are some shops and near by a ice cream shop.
author: Pooh O.

description: to all my kbbq lovers this is the spot!!!! don't live in sf so was curious on what places were good to eat at over here & i came across this restaurant. it's near ocean beach & sutro baths so that's definitely a plus you can come here after ur done going to the beach & finished sight seeing. parking here is DIFFICULT to find went around a couple of times and still couldn't find any parking. but what caught my eye the most was the kimchi fried rice!!! i love kimchi and the fried rice comes with a poached egg on top it was freaking heaven. definitely recommend the galbi, soy garlic chicken, beef bulgogi, & the hot and spicy chicken. the pricing is reasonable! service was great! they gave me & my gf a bigger table bcus we ordered too much food even tho there was a bigger party that had been waiting there longer than us so i really appreciated that.
author: Jocelyn F.

description: Had dinner at the Korean Kitchen.  Ordered the soy garlic chicken, beef tofu soup and bulgogi bibimbop.  Best beef tofu soup I've had in a long time.  Broth is delicious.  You won't go wrong.  Bibimbop was also very good.  Soy garlic chicken was good.  Order the Beef Tofu soup.
author: Carlo W.

description: The fried chicken wasnt as good as i expected. But the fries were really good. The seafood pancake was soso. Price wise is average not expensive. Might give it another try if im craving for korean food.
author: Catherine L.

description: It was my second time coming to the Korean Kitchen and I will definitely keep coming back! This was some of the freshest Korean food that I have ever tasted in my life. The first time I visited, I ordered half/half fried chicken. The flavor of the chicken was so delicious that I also ordered it the second time (which was also so delicious and fresh). If you are visiting, I would definitely recommend it! I also tasted the Kimchi Fried Rice, this is my favorite Kimchi Fried Rice. It is deliciously seasoned and chewy and delicious! It comes with a fried egg on top. This Kimchi Fried Rice is the best I have ever tasted in my life, really. Lastly, I tried the Hot Stone Tofu Bibimbap! I usually order Bibimbap because I love the variety of ingredients. I'm sure the ingredients in this restaurant are some of the freshest in the whole area. If you are touring to San Francisco or you are from the area, like me, come and try the food! Both times I have visited the restaurant, the environment was amazing, my server (Roy) was so kind, helpful and sweet. Visiting this restaurant was one of the best korean restaurant experiences of my life and this restaurant will always be a life-long favorite of mine. The entire experience really amazed me. Thank you so much Korean Kitchen!! And I will see you next time :-)
author: Jasmine J.
